column11: Review Text
Great place, our kids enjoyed to the fullest. Our tour guide put a massive effort to give proper viewing of all the animals. Overall an Amazing experience.

column8: My personal opinion of the amazing journey
column11: It was an amazing experiences. Even though there were less animals, the jeep ride was exceptional. The birds, small to big animals were just amazing. My favorite part was the time i got to hold a little bunny for the first time. The staff was also very friendly. Overall the 10/10 experience and it is worth watching.

This is an open park where the animals wander freely and visitors go on the caged vehicles to see them. Areas are defined to each kind of animal. There are animals like lions, tigers, elephants, hippopotamus, giraffes, zebras etc. Best to go in the mornings and afternoons where animals stay outside. They have a large parking area. Can travel inside by common bus or private jeep. Common bus is cheap and the jeep is LKR 5,000.
Good experience for family. There are 4 zones with animals - lions, tigers, herbivorous animals and elephants. Can book a jeep at the entrance - We went in a 12 seater jeep.

column8: This safari is a surprising hidden gem in Sri Lanka!
column11: We enjoyed our safari here last year so much, we returned again and loved it! The animals are kept very well and have lots of space. We asked for our same guide again and Sudesh did a great job giving us information, animal names, and suggestions for feeding the elephants. Note‚Ä¶. Gandhi the elephant really likes biscotti biscuits! The lions were our favorites and the roaring was way more powerful than we expected. Baby monkeys, two week old donkey, hippos, and fierce hyenas were some animals we enjoyed. Would definitely recommend this safari if you are staying in the area. It was an easy drive for us from The Birds Resort.
Do not go. After issuing the tickets which are non refundable , they said the jeeps are booked for whole day. Absolutely no co ordination, staff utterly irresponsible

column8: Combination of nice things and letdowns
column11: Let's start with the negative side: the DIY walking area. Asking USD 15 and then not giving out any park map, and not having any signs with animal names at each of the blocks with e.g. ostrichs, is a huge letdown. Let alone asking you to pay extra to enter the kiddies farm area, or to see the feeding closeby! Also this part of the park is incomplete, with far more benches than meadows with animals. The safari area (Rs 300 pp extra for a, non-AC, bus seat or Rs 5000 for a jeep for max 6 persons) fares much better. Tiger area, lion area, Asian herbivores (also many not present in Sri Lanka) and African herbivores are nice to see especially for kids or for local adults that have not seen this abroad.

As I Said There are only 7 Animals and More of a park than a safari if you‚Äôre looking for somewhere to go in Sri Lanka do not go here you know actually it has very late jeep safari time. ..ooOOoo.. ü´∂üèº thank youü´∂üèº

column8: A Thrilling Safari Experience at Ridyagama Safari Park
column11: Our visit to Ridyagama Safari Park was an exciting and memorable experience. The park offers a well-organized safari that takes you through various zones, each representing different habitats and a diverse range of animals. The thrill of seeing elephants, lions, and other wildlife in a more natural setting was truly remarkable. The park itself is well-maintained, with clean facilities and clear signage that enhances the overall experience. The safari vehicle was comfortable, and our guide was knowledgeable, providing interesting facts about the animals and the park‚Äôs conservation efforts. The animals appeared to be well-cared for, and it was fascinating to observe them in environments that mimic their natural habitats. One of the highlights of our trip was the close-up encounters with the animals, especially the majestic elephants and the powerful lions. It felt like a real adventure as we drove through the park, with each turn bringing new surprises. The park could benefit from better crowd management..Ridyagama Safari Park offers a fantastic experience for wildlife enthusiasts and families alike. It's an excellent opportunity to connect with nature and learn more about the animals in a safe and controlled environment. We left with great memories and a deeper appreciation for the wildlife conservation efforts in Sri Lanka. Highly recommended!

We went around 10am & turn to be the best time to see most of the animals. We took the private jeep & driver was very professional & explain to us each section animals life style. We also tried the elephant feeding/ bird feeding/ petting zoo it was amazing experience & Sajith was care taker & he was very accommodating. Safari was very good & I would say it‚Äôs one of the true experience‚Ä¶

This experience is more predictable than safari but no less fun! Many beautiful animals such as the Bengal tiger and elephants.  Kids will love it.  Must go for the elephant feeding at 550 LKR to have a close encounter with the elephant.

Just go! Your kids will get the taste of safari for half of the price of Yala and time. My kids loved it. Very clean well maintained healthy and happy animals. We couldnt find the right contact number to book the safari jeep but waited only 30mins when we got there. I heard weekends are very busy so try to avoid it. For family of four, in total it costed around 20,000LKR

It was a good experience and felt like a keep safari in the jungle. Happy to see animals are free and not in the cages like in other zoos. Interesting thing is, we can see many of foreign animals in this park. Specially this is a good place for kids. The birds park also nice and can take the birds on our hands by feeding them. It was nice, but birds doesn‚Äôt have their total freedom.
We were able to see Elephants Lions Tigers and other animals. It‚Äôs a one hour journey inside park . Better arrange English speaking guide in future
Visited One Zoo with family. Saw more wild animals living is open environment that last visit to Yala.
Good place with new experience. But make a advance reservation on safari jeep in weekends and public holidays.

A wonderful experience in Sri Lanka. Very well planed. But only few animals now. What happened to the camels and the Eland‚Äôs shown in the pictures. But loved feeding  Gangs the elephant.the birds were also fun. Have more animals and expand the area.  There is 500 acres in that so definitely can have larger areas and interesting animals too. Love the animals in there natural environment. Nice to see them stress free. Well worth the visit.

Great (mini) Safari! Short drive from Shangrila Hambantota (25-30mins). The safari is more like a large open zoo that you get driven around in. Well priced and staff exceptionally nice and friendly. Purchasing tickets was super easy, transparent and no scams. Everything is posted well. My kids loved feeling the elephant, birds and driving through the Lion enclosure in particular. Its a quick 45min tour if you pay for your own safari truck. Definitely recommend it.

Ridiyagama Park is the first and only zoological park in the country to offer safari-like experience. We (a group of adults and one child) went there around 10am - I'd recommend going as early as possible, because it was already terribly hot by that time (even for us locals living some 100km away). Safari vehicles are also limited in number it seems, another reason to go early. Have to buy an entrance ticket PLUS a ticket for the safari. for the latter, you have two options - bus (low cost, operated by the Zoo itself) or jeep (there is a separate stall to book a jeep). We took the bus and was lucky to get seats at the front. The buses are specially prepared for the safari with iron bars fitted across the windows for added safety. There was a Zoo guide in the bus doing an excellent commentary - the problem was that it was only in Sinhala language. The bus took us through four zones that are available for viewing - African Lions, Herbivores, Tigers and Elephants. In each zone we saw plenty of animals. Such a wonderful experience to see animals roaming free, and see them at close range too. At the end, the bus stops at the small animal zone, where those who wish to do so can get down and go for additional activities (which we did) while others can return in the bus to where the bus ride started. These activities included feeding an elephant, feeding birds, petting animals and fish spa - all of which cost extra - but very reasonably priced. We spent around 4 hours there and had a great time. A must-do activity in Hambantota region.
My kids had a great time at the Safari park. The mini zoo was new & got the chance to feeds the birds & pet animals like turtles, rabbits..

The Safari has segregated sections for Carnivores and Herbivores.. so we move thorugh secure and guarded gates to each section. However  the animals in each section can roam around freely.. they seem relaxed and happy.. and have a snooze anywhere they like.. Be aware.. this place is immensely crowded.. so head over early and book a jeep.. From personal experience,  the safari jeep gave a better experience than the Bus or Van. Not to worry, the jeeps are properly secured for both the safety of us and the animals.
Very well organized place. Can hire a jeep for a group with reasonable price. Had a good time watching lions, bengal tigers, elephants etc

Loved this safari. It‚Äôs ideal for kids of all ages. The guide and driver were very helpful. There was a good variety of animals. It seemed they were well taken care of. Take snacks as the 1 hour ride made our kids hungry.

After the previous experience, now the place is more developed. Now, they have more animals and more organized guided tours. It is really wonderful experience to be inside a zoo, where we are caged but animals are free. Lovely concept. I wonder why they are not increasing the number of animals. More animals will make them happier as well as visitors.

We had to wait nearly an hour to get into a jeep.  Visitors who choosed the bus had to wait even longer. Staff should provide reliable information  and they should provide better service. Animals were malnourished. They need more space .

My 1st visit for this kind of safari experience. spotting animals is guaranteed here because even though animals live freely  this is a man made park. Can observe animals in their natural lifestyle very closely. Have a huge parking area and all the other facilities are available here. You get a free seat in bus for your ride. If you like you can also have a option to go by safari jeep at an additional cost. Still 4 sectors are open to travelers and other sectors are under construction. Hope to visit again after few more sectors are open. Tip - Go in early morning (Opening 8,30 am) place is getting crowded fast in weekends. If you plan to go by Safari Jeep better book it early.

This is a totally different experience you can have in Sri Lanka. You can observe animal's natural lifestyle closely. No animals are caged and they are well adapted to the surroundings. Well maintained washrooms as well.
A good place to see animals, however, they could add more varieties of animals. It would be great if the shops were opened though

My wife and I visited the park last week and as the bus they provide was full we decided to hire a Jeep but were very disappointed to see malnourished Lions . This is like an open Zoo and the animals are very less and it‚Äôs not worth the trip .

We went to the ridiyagama safari park yesterday for our first time and it was really good. We have to go in a bus around the zoo or in a jeep. There were animals roaming around and they were imported from other countries. It is a must visit place if you come near ridiyagama. They will later invlude leopards, cheetahs, giraffes and kangaroos. We saw many scary animals like African lions and bengalian tigers. I recommend his place because you can experience many things.

We visited the safari park during our holiday vacation to Tangalle. It was our 1st visit to this safari park and the experience was good. The park offers seperate jeeps and an ac bus service to visiters in order to explore the area and take photographs. This place consist large lions, bengal tigers , elephants and many other animals. Most of the animals looked well nurished except for the elephants. They seemed to look in starved  and weinkle skinned surrounded in a dusty forest area. The climate was really hot so if you are planning to visit this area be prepared for it. This place also consist of , washrooms, spacious car park and small shops with variety of food and drinks. Overall we were satisfied with the tour and its a ideal place to visit for both kids and adults.

Must visit than the zoo This is a lovely park where visitors can safely enjoy while the animals live freely . There are 4 zones for lions, elephants , tigers and vegans . Animals can be seen closely The visit entrance charge is inclusive of the ride in a comfortable bus. Visitors also have tje facility of organising safari jeep . The jeep is for 6 passengers . All vehicles are safely equipped .and comfortable .Better reserve jeeps in advance . All vehicles are inclusive of guides The entire visit takes approx 45 mts - 1 hour.  Preferably during morning hours. In addition there are rest areas, food outlets , washrooms . Has ample parking . Difficult to reach through public transport .
So we were in a cage like Jeep and animals were roaming free. This was different experience. My kids spotted many animals and were happy to see them roaming about freely.
Really awesome place. Worth the price and beautiful environment and animal variety. Very well planned. Hope to see a full fledged park with added units in near future üëç

We visit with my family during our family vacation. Entry fees is not expnsive. It is worth for money paying. My doughter enjoyed. For her it was good experienced by bus traveling aroung the safari. I recommended for family.
This place better than dehiwala zoo. Today me and my wife visit ridiyagama safari park. We enjoyed lot of.

A great new concept in sri Lanka and a far better alternative to traditional zoos where animals are caged. Instead humans are caged in pretty comfortable air conditioned buses while it travels through the park where animals roam freely Highly recommend this experience

It‚Äôs an open zoo and a new concept to Sri Lanka. Basically humans are the ones who are caged and animals roam free. Humans have to travel in covered buses or safari jeeps to sight the animals. This park consisting of tigers, lions, zebras, elephants has still scope for improvement. And they‚Äôre working on adding new varieties of animals and extending the park. The guide only explains in Sinhalese. Unsure of whether there‚Äôs explanation in English as well. Safari time is 45 mins and would recommend this for a new experience.

Good for a time out with kids , but only a limited collection of animals. Waiting area could have been air conditioned. Lions , tigers, elephants , deers, bulls , peacocks in limited numbers can be seen
This place pays little attention to animal welfare but make big profits by ripping off overseas travellers. Avoid!
Very nice place to visit. Very interesting more than the safari. Lot of animals are available and the instructor also a very good person. I recommended this place for families and groups.
Ridiyagama safari park visit was new experience for us.one of the best open zoo in sri lanka with lot of animals, buses are very new, guides are very helpfull, good luck, do not loose your passion!!!
This is a average open air zoo. Only few sections are open now. Not that many animals either. They have jeeps and buses to go around. Crowded on holidays and weekends.
Ridiyagama safari park visit was new experience for us.one of the best open zoo in sri lanka with lot of animals.

still under development but good experience. happy to see that animals roaming without being caged or chained.. Bengal tiger zone was a new addition and  we were able to see many of them closely. good for visits that include youngsters as they can watch the animals without getting exposed to heat or dust. will visit again for sure..

A new experience in Sri Lanka where the Zoo is in 500 acre land and the animals are in the open environment ( not caged ) and the travelers can go and visit the animals is fully protected bus or in a safari jeep. we can see many animals in this open zoo and the tour guides are providing an excellent service by providing a descriptive introduction.

If you are visiting down south. This is one place that you should visit. Can see the freely roaming wild animals few feet away and they are not caged. If you dont want to go in a big bus and loads of people, they do have Safari Jeep Option with extra payment.

We visited yesterday. Local price for adults is Rs. 350/= each. Park provides AC bus where you can watch animals comfortably.Because it's situated in the dry zone dust is unavoidable. But if you want a jeep you have to pay nearly 2000/= along with 350/=. Anyhow it is worth. Tour guide explains everything. First time experience in Sri Lanka. Currently have only 4 sections African lions, Asian elephants, herbivores and tigers. There is one African elephant in that herd. Security is good. There are few shops where you can buy snacks. There is only one souvenir shop but you can't expect much. Overall it's an really good experience.

When planning a trip to Sri Lanka you will probably hear about Sigiriya, Kandy, and Galle. One place you may not hear about is Ridiyagama Safari Park. It's pretty rough around the edges and if gift shops are your thing (you need to get out more) you'll be disappointed, but the wildlife within the fences of this safari park is great. On the day we arrived the lions weren't getting on, as some lions rescued from Colombo Zoo had been added, so they had men in tractors trying to separate them. It was a bizarre sight. The elephants were really inquisitive and came right upto our jeep which was so cool. My kids loved it. It was a hot dusty day but we saw tigers, lions, elephants and various types of gazelle.
More Animals Must keep as the Area is so Big , Same to Avoid dry environut More Water Ponds  Need to set Up. That will help Animals .

First of its kind park in Sri Lanka. Have to admire the concept here. Having visited  Dehiwala zoo many times and seeing how animals are cruelly caged there this is some kind of a relief to see animals roam freely. You are actually caged here in the vehicle till exit point. Currently there are 4 sections operating and plans are there to extend to 7 sections. African lions, Bengali tigers, herbivores and elephants are the sections operating as of now. You need to buy a ticket for 350 rupees and they will take you through the park in an air conditioned bus. Around 30 people can be accommodated per a bus. Only 2 buses were operating at the time we visited and roughly 30mins waiting time was there per a bus. But if there‚Äôs a large crowd the waiting time climbs up. They call in the order of ticket numbers so there‚Äôs no hassle to run for the bus. Total tour takes around 1 hour. During busy days they allow private vehicles like vans and buses to park with their guides to avoid the rush for park buses. In addition there‚Äôs a safari Jeep service also for which you have to pay around 2000 per a Jeep which could carry 5 6 people. Altogether a nice experience and specially recommended for kids.

The animals are kept in their natural surroundings.This Safari Zoo is managed by the government. It is still developing to come to 500 acres when fully completed. There were 4 zones, namely Lion, Tiger, general and Elephants are presently under way. Each zone is 35 acres and the the total area under animals presently is 140 acres. First zone we saw was Lion zone. They are from Africa. We saw 4 lions closer to the road lying down in the shade of the trees.next zone isa common animals where yo see Zeebras,Horses. Donkeys, Deers, Camals, Ostrich, Hipos etc. Next zone we saw was Tigers from Begal India. The other zone is the elelphant zone and one we saw was from India and other Sri lanakan ones are very tame and even came near the bus.They were from that area. Entrance to the Tigers and Lions are conered by high fences and entrance is with double doors where the bus from them have to enter from one gate and come between the two doors.  THE OPENED DOOR IS CLOSED BEFORE OPENING THE OTHER AS A PRECAUTION OF lIONS AND TIGERS from escaping. The guide gives the information need and if anyone wants more information, he readily explains.It took one hour or so for us to see all. You must get this experience.

The safari park is a standard affair, but there seems to be several obvious animal welfare issues, worse of which is a full sized African Bull elephant being chained up, for health and safety reasons, and clearly in some state of distress. In Europe the park would be instantly closed down until the problems were addressed.
Maintained almost to international standards, this park offers a wide range of wold life you would not see anywhere in SL. The guides are professionals. Certainly worth a visit if you are down south.

This is a place of future. We need to see animal and feel free. Same time we need to see them at their natural places and natural activities. But when we go wild safari, we are harming to their natural behavior. Aren't we ? So this will be a way to help animal and our selves both in same time. This is not a big and place with many attractions. But visiting this place will help them to improve more and more. You can see Elephants in heards, Lion with lioness, Bengal tigers in angry mood, many herbivorous in batches on free feeding. Guides are well aware about the animals and describe nicely. Not bad staff support. Please visit and help them to grow the concept. You will feel free

I traveled with two young kids and we all enjoyed and had a novel experience. Ticket is like USD 2 per local adult but may be bit expensive for a foreigner. Coaches are provided by the park for free but if you want more personalize experience you can hire a safari jeep by paying extra. Total travel time is 1 hr - 1.5 hrs. The park has different sections like Bengal Tiger section, African Lion section, Elephant section and vegan animal section.   We have seen good number of lions, tigers, elephants, hipos, camels and various kind of antelopes there. The park arrangement also in good shape as some of these sri lankan parks are notorious for poor management and maintenance.  The road leading to the park is in poor condition. Recommend to visit if someone is traveling to down south but don‚Äôt see any point of travelling exclusively.

This place is a hidden gem. We have been on Safari in South Africa and the Tiger Park in India but we were far more impressed with this. We were able to see a large number of animals in their natural environment. Lions, Tigers, Elephants, Zebra etc. etc. Costs a bit more to get a separate Jeep with a guide, but it is well worth it. Several more animals such as Giraffe and Kangaroo are expected shortly. Early morning or late afternoon is the best time to visit,

This is best place where we can see animals behaviour with minimum disturbance to them. Can not say 100% no harm but up to maximum extent we can feel their freedom. The place disigned considering pasanger safety as well. The place need to further divelop with infrastructure such as surrounding roads.

Very nice enjoyed the safari the driver n staff member were really good. Got to see elephants close even the African tusker. As it was noon we were not sure if we 'll get to see many animals, we were lucky saw hippos, 5 lions & lioness. Ostrich & camels. Kids had immense fun. Good guides explaining well. Took us close ton45 min to go around. Early morning is the ideal time to catch majority of these animals.

Environment in this safari park provides a fairly natural setting to the animals, with a lot of aged trees and shrubs for good camouflage. It gives the impression that the whole area is an open jungle unless one spot the perimeter protective walls which could be seen at some places. When creepers and shrubs cover such gaps it will definitely be awesome. Currently only a part is open to visitors but it seem that the rest of the park is been set up so that the entire 500 acres of land will be available to spot the animals hailing from different parts of the world. Heard that one area will have Australian native wildlife too! When comparing with other commercial safari parks I have seen so far "Ridiyagama Safari Park" seem to be very much better.  Hope that the park will add Giraffe, Rhinos, Tapirs, Tigers, Jaguars, Leopards etc. etc. to make the experience better. We had a friendly tracker who explained things very well.

It's a safari park with still ongoing constructions. Adults will be charged Rs350 which will include approximately 1hour safari from bus. A guide will explain relevant things at various stations. Currently only 3areas are open for public. Kids would love the experience as they could see various animals such as zebras,camels,hipos,lions etc at fairly natural habitat.

as only three zones are opened for general public there is not much to visit in the location. but i hope the developments to be over soon and wll 13 zones to be opened for public soon as the experience will enhance a lot by it. and once this is completed this will be one of the south asia's largest attractions.

This is a different place in Sri Lanka to visit...Currently this is kind of average place to visit for animal lovers..but this is developing and it will give excitement to travelers in near future...but in averagely good place to pay a visit

The place is unique as you can see animals in a fairly large area roaming at their pace. Can see mainly animals of other countries including the lions, zebras, camels, Indian deers, hipos,...etc.  These are not entirely wild animals, but being in habitats which are pretty large compared to a traditional zoo. The lion area gives you the feeling of Jurassic Park experience. And there is a separate area for Elephant to hang around. Seem organised well.

It was a good experience to Sri lankan as this is the first open zoo in SL. It's is nicely organized/clean but still need some more animals. Still the zoo is not complete and expanding so after all done i think it will be more existed. If you are a foreigner better if you can visit this place only if you're close by to it. The Tangalle beach is one of the best beach in down south.  Not so crowded. beautiful view.

Actually it was a most excited experience with wild animals live we closely monitoring. First time we have seen this Lions fit with each others in meal time . they waiting near the gates to jump to out side but with great walls & gates it will be a dream. any way its a lovely experience we had in sun set time Lions are going to be fit with barking each . other animals also in good manner to watch .

It's newly open place in Sri Lanka for safari.Wild animals such as  Lions, Elephants, Monkeys, Zebras live in this area. Those animals are mix of Asian and Africans, specially Lions are from Africa. According to the official spokesmen of this Safari park it would expand more in further. I can recommend this place to watch many wild types of animals in one place.
First safari park. Enjoyed very much. Good transportation. Still under development. Good infrastructure facilities.
A new experience for ZOO Lovers. Its an open wild Park, We had an amazing time. Good Service and Hospitality.
Still only 3 zones are open and they have variety of deers and other animals in one zones and lions and elephants in other two zones. They planning to expandit near  future to cover 500 acres land.

Very nice park to visit, this place has lots of different animals from different country‚Äôs, it will be a very good park once completed, Bengal tigers will be available to see from September, you get see  to lots of wild animals very close distance. Definitely recommend this place.

You can see natural behaviors of wild animals. In zoo animals are stuck in cage. Here in Ridiyagama safari park animal can freely move. We went on 2016 July. Hope now many animals will be available. You cant take your private vehicle. Designated safari park authority vehicle is allowed for tour. Love this concept

It was a New experience to Sri Lanka. Traveling the AC coach with Guide around the park its amazing. There are three park available at the moment and they will added few park in near. Specially watching lions in a open face is an unique experience.
But it is clear that they don't enjoy the life. It's man made habitat and the climate is also not suitable for some of them.

This is a new experience to Sri Lanka, We have to travel around the Park from a well-protected Safari Bus. The Guide in the bus explained about the park and animals. Good for children. need more animals for the park

We were skeptical of this safari park but upon visiting, we felt that the authorities really did try to make a difference to the tiny zoos in the city by allowing animals to roam freely even though in a controlled area. It was encouraging to see even hippos and Llamas chilling out. The fact that tigers, lions and hippos were mating and producing offspring was also quite heartening. We took a safari jeep so we didn't have to wait for the bus with a ton of other people but its your choice. Don't expect too much at this park, just be mindful also that 3 or 4 more zones are under construction. For us, its a big difference from zoos and its good to see animals looking less stressed out
Thank you and excellent service! Animals are free to move..more animals can observed in early morning ...crowded...need an outlet for dining  ..Thankx

We visited Ridiyagama Safari Park on our way from Katharagama and it turn out as one of the best experience I had. There are two options for Safari; by common AC bus or renting out a safari jeep. Both the vehicles are built with safety measures. Only three areas of the Zoo is open yet; African lions, Herbivorous animals and the Sri Lankan Elephants sections. But you will get a chance to see some animals roaming freely not like in Dehiwala Zoo. Every ride gets a free guide and they are very fluent in knowledge. The staff said that the several other sections will be open in near future like Bears section, Australian Kangaroos section.

We had taken Children from our school to visit Ridiyagama Safari Park. Entrance fees local - Children below 12: 100/- Adults: 300/- Included in the ticket is a bus tour of the park. They have four Safari Jeeps and they charge 2000/- to hire the jeeps They have 3 areas opened at the moment. Carnivores section which are the lions. Herbivores section which has a variety of animals such as llamas, zebras, bucks, deer, donkey, wild boar, hippopotamus etc. Third section is for elephants. They are also preparing few more areas, the üêÖ tiger, leopard and the giraffe sections which they hope to open by 2019. The whole Safari takes you about 1 hour. It was a super experience, and really fun. Each enclosure has big gates and safety precautions so that animals don't escape and gives a Jurrasic Park kind of feel üòÄ

We were amazed to see this novel experience in Sri Lanka.A great initiative. The staff who took us on the safari had sound knowledge on both native and foreign animals. I recommend  jeep ride over the bus although there is an additional amount involved as this gives more privacy and more attention.

This place is not completed yet, it only has three sections; Lions section, elephants section and herbivores section. These areas were quite big and looked like the natural environment.  May be in another two years this might be fully completed. Hence, no point going all the way from Colombo for this. But might as well visit this place on your way to Kataragama or to other place. The entire tour took about 1 hour in the bus. We did not have to stay in long quest to get tickets or to get into the bus although it was a Sunday afternoon. The tour guide was very good and patient enough to answer our questions. But he was explaining only in sinhala, not sure about his ability to communicate in English. The bus was in good condition. There was a food court area but I do not think you can get a full meal there. Had basic but not smelly toilet facilities like any other place in Sri Lanka.

Today we visited the safari park and from the get go was incredibly frustrated and disappointed. If you are not a local you are from the get go you get ripped off. A local ticket cost 300rp and a foreigner pays 2,500rp 8 times more! You are then told to wait around for an hour until you go in, but there is no system  unless you speak fluent sinhala as they just call our ticket numbers with close to 100 people standing around good luck getting through. When you do get through on a jam packed bus again unless you understand fluent sinhala you are not able to understand anything. The enviroment they have the animals in is more like overgrown weeds non maintained land than trying to cater for the animals natural enviroment. The only animals tgat seemed to be at home were the elephants and even then one was rocking on the spot because it was chained to the one place. Oh and make sure you eat before you go! As you are safer only consuming packed chips than the fly blown non temperature controlled food in the poor excuse for a "food court" as they lable it. Also think about limiting your liquids or packing your own toilet paper as there is not even toilet roll holders for their to be toilet paper. Witnessed cleaners just spraying the whole toilet down with the bidet and mopping everything over with the same mop. I understand that it is Sri Lanka and standards are different however my Sri Lankan parent in laws were also frustrated with this place. I do not recomend wasting your time and extreme costs of tickets compared to the locals it really isn't worth it. It is not catered for anyone but the locals.
One of the best parks I‚Äôve ever experienced in SriLanka.. However liquor, smoking and many other things banned in this place for the safety of animals as well as guests..

On the way back from kataragama our family stayed one night at Kithala Resort .Next day after the lunch we started our journey back to Colombo and on the way to Colombo while we were in Hambantota we diverted to Ridiyagama Safari Park. The park area is huge and it is not fully completed. This was the first time we visited the safari park in Sri Lanka. We had to park our vehicle and got in to the safari bus which was very comfortable and  screened with iron bars for safety. The park was divided in to several sections. carnivorous animals, Elephants sections etc.The guide in the bus was very good and he explained the sections. He also said that within next two years they have planed to complete the safari with animals from Sri Lanka and also from other countries. If you are passing Hanbantota this is wonderful place to visit.
Its a new experience to sri lankan.there are 3 sections.lions and bengali tigers, sri lankan eliphants and animals like veries kind of dears,zebras ....ect.they provide transportation.

The setup for the safari park is very good. However the waiting times were very long as we went on a school holiday. As this is a new park I acknowledge that they aren't fully equipped to handle large volumes of people because we had to wait 3 hours for a safari bus. The safari it self was very good the driver gave us the opportunity to photograph animals. And this was a guided tour. Probably recommended visiting on a school day as it might be less busy

This is a much needed animal park in Srilanka. The park itself is well designed though small and relatively short route around. The animals in captivity have larger area to roam around giving them more freedom than in an enclosed Zoo. They provide a bus service to be driven around , but unable to take photographs as the shutters are put on to prevent animal attacks. We arranged the Safari jeep available in the premises, which gives privacy and the facility to take photographs at will. But the jeep driver was in a hurry to get back cutting short the tour as they got another group waiting to hire them. The staff is enthusiastic and eager to detail the animals. More space and animals are needed to make this safari park is a success. Shoul encourage more locals to visit this place.

The first thing you have to do is buying tickets, once you arrived. It's because you will have to wait in a long queue to get into a safari bus according to the ticket number order. A ticket was only Rs. 300 for a local adult, which is reasonable. At the moment there are 3 animal zones, namely; Lion, Vegetarian & Elephant. And they're planning of having 9 zones in near future. A nice explanation will be given at the bus, regarding the animals seen. Washroom, food court and ample free parking facilities are available.

When we reach there in the afternoon it was very crowded. People waiting to get in to the coach. There were few Lions, Elephants, and few more varieties of animals. The Safari Park  is still under construction yet to develop. Hope to visit again and think it will have more animals by that time.

The most beautiful open zoo safari i have ever been to. However the vast space needs to be filled with carnivorous animals soon. Because aside from a couple of lions no such beasts dwell there, for example leopards, sri lanka own. We were tild that In the coming years up till 2019 they will be introducing new species into the park.
Great to see so many animals in one location. Short but good experience in the open zoo. Good for family and kids.

We tried Dehiwala and Rabukkana zoo before we went here. So we got to know this could be the only place we can show little ones a lion. After two heart breaks we hoped for the best but it was nothing but another disappointment. Even worse we had to travel 250kms to get disappointed. It seems like the zoo or the safari park as officially state still mostly under construction.  If you go to Hambantota and if you want to see a lion so badly this is a good place for it. Thoug it says it is a 500 acer land there aren't more than few dozens of animals. It is still more of a bare land. The entrance ticket for Rs 300 with a free bus ride inside the park. But on a busy day you might have to wait more than a hour to get a free bus ride. Otherwise a jeep would cost Rs 2000 and it would only be a 40 minute ride across the park. Relatively to this Yala is a much better bet, though it doesn't have lions at least it is full of trees.

It was a fantastic experience to us rather than just visiting a normal zoo . All animals living  free with nature. We have to go in a vehicle provided by the  authorities. They have passenger buses and  Jeeps.We took a jeep and  they provided a instructor who explained all. They are  expanding the  area to have more animals.

Visited this park with friends. Still not complete.Only the Lion , Elephant , African sections are complete. The next is the Tiger section to be done soon. Very good concept . Would be great once the entire 500 acres is developed. The guide was very knowledgable & courteous. The bus for the tour was very comfortable. At Rs.200 for locals & Rs.2500 the tickets were reasonably priced.This would be an alternative to crowded Yala park for visitors who would like to see a few exotic animals in a short time.

We visited the park with family and friends. Being a Saturday it was packed. Foreigners are charged Rs 2500/= which I think is appalling considering the park is not even nearing completion. The staff appear poorly trained and hardly any animals to be seen. Most areas are under construction and. The staff in the refreshment stalls couldn't care less about you as these few shops are the only option for miles. The guide's try their best to drag on the tour and make it worth your while but sadly they don't have much to work with. Wouldn't recommend the trip till construction is completed

the children really enjoyed seeing the animals we took the private safari jeep getting there was a bit confusing if you are travelling from kirinda or hambanthota taking the road to sooriyavewa and then to ridyagama is the best carpet road but little bit longer

Well as of now it has only three zones, elephant, Lion and herbivore, our guide told us that another 55 acres will be commsioned during April with Bengal  tigers. Plan of the zoo and its progress is very good though some more animal including  more animals to already open zones are required. It's nice to see animals roaming freely in vast area compared to a caged enclosure of a traditional zoo. Two types of visits are offered one , group tour of 20 fax in and AC bus with comes with your entrance ticket or you can hire a safari jeep for a private jeep 6 adults and may be one or two small ones. It's not AC. Jeep gives more vivid photos as against the bus as closed windows may be dust and photos will not be great. Jeep hire is separate Rs 2000/- Infrastructure for facilities Like toilets and restaurants are all completed but as it is for all Sri Lankan places eating options choices are limited and not up to standard. For locals it is a must see IMO. Foreign tourists if time permits should visit there if you have already experienced a open safari zoo elsewhere in the word you will easily get bored with limited  tour as of now. Hope it will gain recognition as prime tourist hotspot once it's completed. Guides ( employed by wild life dpt) are good but lacks charisma fluency in English to cater to foreign tourist market. That's one aspect to look into

This is the only Safari park in Sri Lanka to experience real wild life in their own behaviors. African Lions, Hippos, Ostriches, Camels, Elephants, Donkeys, Zebra's and lots of other animals are there in this Free Zone. Entry fee for Locals is @ LKR 300 per person. and there are air Conditioned Busses to take you through the park. and the Busses will get the maximum of people to go on the safari (Meaning : you will have to sit with unknown people and go the tour) OR You can get a Safari Jeep @ LKR 2000 cost and go on safari privately. You can accommodate 5-8 people in a Jeep + there will be a guide who will explain in detail on all what you see during the Safari. Tour will take 1-2 HRS. There will be Kangaroos in this safari SOON. As per the guide who explained us, they are going to open another Zone with Kangaroos in April 2017.

Visited this safari park recently and was surprised with the new developments taking place to give the visitors best options to view the wild life. Though small area is in operation at present, the rest of the larger area is still under construction and we were told that the full park will be in operational use in near future. The buses provided comfortable ride while the guides are very helpful in explaining the details and answering all sorts of related questions. The tour typically takes one hour and better to visit the place early in the morning else in a crowded day you may have to wait in a queue for a scheduled bus to pick you into the park. Private vehicles are not allowed inside the park.

Recently opened, being developed stage by stage. Good opportunity to see animals in a free habitat with lots of space. Preferably visiting is recommended early morning or evening where animals are seen out of their hiding places. First hand experience with lions, it was wonderful to see them walking freely in thier habitat. Very educational as the tour guide gave us a very informative briefing about each animal on the way. The zoo hopes to expand by June 2017, where more animals will be accomadated (i.e : Bears, Leopards etc.) Well worth the ride and the money.) Travelling advised via Sooriyawewa - Padalangala Road, and turn Left near the IOC Filling Station.

It was a great experience for all of us, although only 3 zones were open to the public.  They seem to have great plans for the park (lodging, night safari, elephant watching etc) and will complete most of the work within a year or so. The rest rooms were clean. Not sure if they have English speaking tour guides.

We visited the place on 10th Dec 2016. Located close by to Madunagala hot water wells. You have to turn from Padalangala (Embilipitiya - Nonagama hwy) towards Sooriyawewa and drive about 8km along Padalangala - Sooriyawewa road. (Sign boards are poorly designed and placed highlighting the name LB finance therefore you have to follow them carefully)Then there is a huge board on your right side and turn towards Ridiyagama. The park is located 4-5km from the main road.The road is bit damaged but can go by any vehicle without a problem. The ticket is Rs300 per person, There are 5 safari buses and they start operating from 8am. the best time to go there is feeding hours which is 8am - 11am and in the evening. They are closing at around 4.30-5pm. The total journey is about 45mins to 1hr. Buses are air conditioned and there is a guide who knows exactly where the animals are. We saw lions, buffaloes, ostriches, elephants, hippos,  deers, camels during the ride. The park is still under construction and they are planning to have tigers, jaguars, rhinos etc very soon. Eventhough we visited there on a long weekend there were not much of a crowd. that may be because of lack of awareness and promotions. You can visit NLDB farm (Next door) and madunagala hot water springs which are very closeby to the park. For further details pls contact them on - 0473620410 Hope this helps

The park is open for visitors from 8.30 am to 4.30 pm. Best time to see animals is early morning and late evening. Animals try to hide under a shade during the day time. Remember this is is not another zoo. you would not be able to see all the animals at same time. But you will see most of the if you are lucky. For an example, there are five free roaming adult lions and two new born lion cubs in the lion zone at the moment. But mostly you will be able to see 2 - 4 lions at a time. If you get access from Sooriyawewa, roads are in good quality. Access roads from Ambalantota and Ridiyagama are under renovation. It will be completed during the January, 2017. As this is a new park, some improvements are still in progress. A new Safari jeep service was launched since 24/12/2016. Number of Shuttle buses will be doubled since 01/01/2017. Lot of Safari animals including Giraffes, Black rhinoceros, Wildebeest and Sable antelope will arrive from South Africa before  end of March, 2017. Bengal tigers and Kangaroos are already arrived. New Bengal tiger zone and Australian zone will be opened to the visitors before end of March. Sloth bear and Leopard zones will be opened to the visitors at mid 2017. Already there are some food outlets. Main restaurant will be opened in 2017.

The park has only a few buses to take the visitors on the safari and as a result, after purchasing the tickets you may end up waiting for 1 1//2 to 2 hours till you get your turn, if there are large crowds. As we have 2 small kids, had to turn back and go. Suggest to go in the morning, ticket counters open at 8am.

This is an important place to  visit in a trip to Katharagama. Even though it is in its infant stage you can have a feeling of going in a safari in Sri Lanka. It is exciting to see world largest lions in their natural habitats. Visitors should  strictly follow the instructions given by the tour guides.

We were persuaded by our driver to visit this place on our way to Galle.  We were promised leopards etc but to our disappointment, we only saw elephants, wild boars, deer, peacocks and other animals which were a dime a dozen elsewhere in Sri Lanka.  The animals were too few here (same problem as Yala national park) and the visit was not worth the Rps 2500 per person.

It's Nice Place to visit, Staff is very friendly & Given good service. Ambalantota to Ridiyagama Entrance rood is very bad but Suriyawewa road is quite ok. we sow few African lions, 3 Elephant's & few of other animals. This is nice experience but it's more better if they have more animals & if they can repair entrance roads.

Luckily I went with some Sri Lankan friends otherwise I would probably never have fund the place...As a foreign teacher here I benefitted from my work visa otherwise foreign prices are way to high...about 10 times local prices, over 10$ Its new and a work in progress but I liked what seemed to be a less exploitative attitude to the animals...we stayed closed in the bus with a friendly guide...and saw an ostrich, elephants, lions and a variety of wild animals It was nice seeing some bears playing in a separate pen and being told not to take photos...I think the park has a great future

The safari park is so large and it is nice to see animals roaming freely. There are 3 zones as of now in the park and several A/C buses which can facilitate about 20 passengers are in operation. As of now the journey takes around 45 minutes covering the 3 zones - Lions, Wild animals and Elephants. The park is still under construction and seems well maintained. There is a spacious parking area. Cannot be happy about dining facilities though. They put you into into the bus in the ticket number order. So buy tickets as soon as you get to the premises. Recommended to go in the morning and late afternoon, since animals will be more active at those times. Heard this will be largest safari park in asia after completion. Hope the tour will be much more interesting after completion.

It was a nice & unforgettable experience which we had. Though it doesn't have much animals ( cause its still under process of bringing more animals) its a really really nice experience to us as well as i hope to all other srilankans. Only that matter we have to stay long time to get into a bus & have the ride. Cause they have only four busses & they are getting a lots of visitors than they expected. Wish as they say there will be more animals in near future.

I believe that in the future when all the section will be open, it will be quite worth visiting. I hate zoos but here animals have relatively spacious areas, people cannot touch them, feed them and animals are not caged. Today, it was a waste of time since the place is quite far from other popular places to visit in Sri Lanka. Also, even though there were some tourists in the zoo's tour bus (we paid RS2500), the guide didn't even try to translate what he was saying in English or any other foreign language. Rude.

We were disappointed in this park, price (RS 2500 for foreign) is too high for such small amount of animals in very bad conditions, e.g. we did not see bengal tigers, leopards, bears. Many zones are under construction. Instead of 2 hours, excursion length was less than 1 hour, guide has had bad English. I do not recommended it to you.

The safari park is still under construction and our guide has advised us it will be finished at another two or three years time. we were waiting almost 3 hours to take our safari bus since they have only 5 buses. the staff doesn't have any politeness. they are very granted. the person who issuing the tickets (don't know the name) said "You have to wait one or one an half hours. if you like only buy the tickets". I don't find any one of them are qualified to work such a places like this. first all of the staff need to learn what is the customer service is. It was half an hour drive through the park and there are only 3 lions and 5 elephants and some few other animals too. can not recommend this place to any one at this point. need lots of improvement as well as the park and the staff too.

For a change we were the ones in a cage ( covered coach - 45 minutes drive around ) observing the animals as they appeared to be in their natural habitat. Three sectors are open - the lions - sector 1 separated by high fences - next the herbivorous animals - and a section for elephants. Work in progress and in time to come it should be a good safari experience.

We went there on our route back home from kataragama.It was a nightmare finding the location. I haven't seen such stupid bill board positioning any where. Please be careful if you are using  google maps.It will most probably will give you some by roads only god knows where it heads. If you are going via Sooriyawewa, you have to go to town and make a right.Then make another left after 5-6 km on the road. Notice that the directions to hot water springs will guide you there. (Stupid bill boards can only be seen once you make the right turns) Park Park is still under construction. It was bit crowded as it was a weekend. Tickets were priced Rs.300 for locals. All has to wait for 25 seater bus to see the zoo(they have 7 buses now) We had to wait around 1.5 hours to get to a bus. There were 3 zones.Lions,wild animals and elephants. It was very hot and sunny and not a good time for too see animals.Go in early morning or in evening.But still good to see animals roaming freely than in a typical zoo. In the elephant park one cub came and cuddled with the bus.It was nice experience for all of us. Concerns 1.There's still only a one place you can get lunch.But only sub standard fried rice. So better to take your lunch there. 2.There were 2 drunken buggers were in our bus.It was a very hard time and unless for the patience for our guide the trip would have been a waste. So authories should look into these type of things seriously. In a summry there is no other zoo in the country to see animals roam freely. It will be a good experience to all.

It was a wonderful experience visiting the first ever safari park set up in Sri Lanka. We boarded an AC bus which took us around to see the animals. There are 3 zones operating in the park currently and we saw Lions, Zebras, Ostrich, Deer, African Cape Buffalos, Elephants, Giraffes, Bactrian Camels, Arabian Orix, Lechwe and Indian Blue Bulls walking freely in their zones. The tour took us one hour and the tour guide was excellent. The guide explained very well, in detail, in Sinhalese. Although our group could understand what was said, there was a another group of people in the bus and I think they were foreigners from a neighbouring country, and couldn't have understood what was explained. The children and elderly in our group also enjoyed.

There's only 3 sectors in operation at the moment, "African Lions Area" / "Non Meat Eating Mammal Area" / "Elephants Area"... First one has about 4 lions at the moment, and the second have the highest number and lot of varieties.. At the moment there's 5 Sri Lankan elephants but they are planing to increase to 15.. The animals seems to be in a lively mood than in the Zoo, and interesting to see them in a free area than in a cage.. My wife and kids enjoyed the whole tour but for me it was not that much entertaining like going on a wild life tour.. That's why I have mentioned it depends on your preference...

We visited this safari park though it's not fully completed. Currently three zones are opened for public. You can see lions, African animals and elephants etc This will be great location once it's fully completed in upcoming years. But current opened areas are enough to have a safari for more than 1 hour.

Still in its development stages but we where happy with the visit. We saw lot of animals: lions, zebra, ostrich, deer, hippo, buffalo, and elephants. If you are visiting the hot springs nearby then its worth a visit too. Kids loved it.
